text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 18) (Carer’s Benefit and 
Carer’s Allowance - Earnings Disregard) Regulations 2024. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2024 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2024.

title: to the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 2005), with the consent
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for increases in the earnings disregard which apply 
to Carer’s Benefit and Carer’s Allowance, which form part of the Budget 
measures announced on 1 October 2024. 

In the case of Carer’s Benefit, the weekly earnings limit is being increased from 
€450.00 to €625.00 per week with effect from 3 July 2025. 

In the case of Carer’s Allowance, the weekly means disregard is being increased 
from €450.00 to €625.00 for a single person and from €900.00 to €1250.00 for 
a couple. The increases in the disregard will take effect from 3 July 2025. 

These Regulations also correct a misalignment in the current text of article 167 
which relates to eligibility for the Carer’s Support Grant in circumstances where 
the person being cared for is undergoing medical or other treatment of a 
temporary nature in an institution. The effect of the revised alignment is to 
provide clarity that the 13-week period applies to both of subparagraphs (i) and 
(ii) of Article 167(b) and confirms, in line with article 56(a) as respects Carer’s 
Benefit, and article 136(1)(a) as respects Carer’s allowance, that a carer 
continues to qualify for receipt of the Carer’s Support Grant for any period or 
periods not exceeding 13 weeks in a year where the person being cared for 
undergoes medical or other treatment of a temporary nature in an institution, or 
is temporarily being cared for, or temporarily residing with another person. 
Finally, the Regulations also update the titles of the relevant Departments 
concerned.
